Remaining Raw, Unidentified Changes for v3.2.1
These are the raw changes from NTSC 1.02 to SD Remix 3.2.1.
The eventual goal is for this section to be emptied as these changes are identified and moved to other files for SD Remix.
This is only for DOL changes. Full SD Remix requires other files to be changed.
[_glook]
Revision ---- DOL Offset ---- Hex to Replace ---------- ASM Code -

	-==-


Old Widescreen Code (SDR Staticly placed @ 803FC7F0 and 803FC7FC)
Enables widescreen. Way out of date, much better ones available.
[Dan Salvato]
NTSC 1.02 ---- 0x803FC7F0 -----
61796572 20436F75 6E742053
->
39C00001 38600006 4BC252C8  # Widescreen 1

00000000 803FC7EC

C03F0034 2C0E0001 41820024 3C004080  # Widescreen 2
90010030 3C004040 90010034 C0010030
EC210032 C0010034 EC210024 39C00000
281E0000 4BF6DC7C


	-==-


Hold Start to exit results screen (SDR Staticly placed @ 803FC834 and 803FC87C and 0x803FC8B0)
Normally, the results screen requires all players to be ready in order to exit the results screen.
This can get annoying when either a player is being absent-minded or when the controller is still plugged in and the player has left to do something else.
This is a shortcut to dealing with that, where you just hold start to exit.
[achilles]
NTSC 1.02 ---- 0x803FC834 ------
00000000 00000000 00000000 00000000 00000000 00000002 803009E0 803FC804
803FB538 804D6DC8 00000000 42080000 00000000 00000003 80300A88 803FC810
00000000 804D6DCC
->
3C808047 3E208046 6231B0FC 3E40817F 6252FFF7 3A600000 8691000C 8EB20001
569400C7 4182000C 3AB50001 48000008 3AA00000 9AB20000 3A730001 2C130004
41A0FFD8 4BD7B7E0
-------------- 0x803FC87C ------
00000000 49742400 3F800000 00000003 00000000 803FC81C 00000000 804D6DD4
00000000 49742400 41200000 00000009 00000000
->
3E40817F 6252FFF7 3A600000 8E920001 2C140096 4180000C 38001000 48000014
3A730001 2C130004 41A0FFE4 80030008 4BD7B97C
-------------- 0x803FC8B0 ------
00000000 00000000 00000000 00000000 00000000
->
38000000 3E40817F 6252FFF8 90120000 4BDA78A8


	-==-


Stock Dependent Revival Platform Colors (SDR Staticly placed @ 803FA3E8)
The coloring of the revival platform changes based on how many stocks a player has remaining.
4 stocks left (via a minigame or something...) = purple
3 stocks left = green platform
2 stocks left = orange platform
1 stock left = red platform (as in, danger....you're about to lose)
[achilles]
Revision ---- DOL Offset ---- Hex to Replace ---------- ASM Code -
NTSC 1.02 ---- 0x803FA3E8 -----
804D5860 804D5868 804D5870 476D4C61 6E675479 70654A50 00000000 476D4C61
6E675479 70655553 00000000 4E6F2D44 65627567 2D526F6D 00000000 44656275
672D4465 76656C6F 70000000 44656275 672D526F 6D000000 804D5890 803FA414
803FA424 803FA434 804D5898 56657273 7573204D 6F646520 2020203E 00000000
52657375 6C742054 65737400 4C616E67 75616765 203A2000 5075626C 69636974
793A2000 44624C65 76656C20 3A200000 496B2044 65627567 20466C61 67203A00
4E657720 44656643 616C6320 3A000000 476C6F62 616C2044 61746120 45646974
->
7C7E1B78 3FE08016 63FFB094 7FE803A6 4E800021 2C030001 408200C0 3C60801A

625200FF 92300AC4 92500AF0 92300B90 92300CE0 92300D18 7FC3F378 4BCDAB48


	-==-


Tournament Overtime (SDR Staticly placed @ 80191484)
Breaks ties by percent in regulation and makes sudden death mode a normal 3 minute match.
[_glook]
NTSC 1.02 ---- 0x18E064 -----
80030004 2C000000 40820014 807E04E4 38000001 9803004D 48000010 807E04E4 38000000 9803004D 2C1F0005 40820058

2C030000 41A20008 3BC00000 7FDD032E 4BEA2C54


	-==-


Stock Control/Crew Battle Mode (SDR Statically placed @ 801912C4)
Essentially, this hack gets rid of the damage modifier for handicap and replaces it with controllable stocks so that one player can spawn with say 6 stocks and another can spawn with 4.

When handicap is set to "ON" you can set custom stocks per player (1 stock - 9 stocks).

When handicap is set to "AUTO" you can set custom stock per player (1 stock - 9 stocks) just like when handicap is "ON." However, upon re-entering the character select screen, your handicap will be set to the amount of stocks you had at the end of the game. If you had zero stocks (as in you lost), the game will set your stock to the current stock setting (any stock amount higher than nine will be set nine). This allows for easy crew battles. You can still change the stocks manually if needed (rage quits etc.).
[Jorgasms]
Version -- DOL Offset ------ Hex to Replace ---------- ASM Code
NTSC 1.02 ---- 0x18DEA4 -----
48000008 83A30008 801E0000 7C1F0000 40820080 3C808048 388499B8 3BC40007 88040007 28000000 4182001C C022AD40
4BFFF159 887E0000 3803FFFF 981E0000 4800000C C022AD08 4BFFF141 3C608048 386399B8 3BC30008 88030008 28000000
41820020 7FA3EB78 C022AD40 4BFFF11D 887E0000 3803FFFF 981E0000 4800005C 7FA3EB78 C022AD08 4BFFF101 4800004C
40810014 387C0000 38800010 481E0A3D 48000038 2C1F0005 40820024 3C608047 386371C4 80030004 2C000000 41820010
387C0000 38800010 481E0A11 7F83E378 C022AD08 4BFFF0B5 8001002C 83E10024 83C10020 83A1001C 83810018 38210028
7C0803A6 4E800020 7C0802A6 90010004 9421FF78 93E10084 93C10080 93A1007C 7C7D1B78 4BFFE25D 3BC30000 387D0000

	-==-


Ledge Invincibility Attrition (SDR Statically placed @ 80191768)
This basically make ledge invincibility behave similarly to shields, in that after grabbing the ledge a few times in quick succession, subsequent grabs will reduces ledge invincibility. The ledge invincibility recovers over time, like shields, and is reset when you die, just like shields. (I figure this is a better solution that the one PM has, not only because I feel it feels more natural, but also because of things like the haxdash that can circumvent it. - _glook)
Notes: http://smashboards.com/threads/melee-gecko-codes-guide-and-discussion.327311/page-35#post-19218896
[_glook]
Version -- DOL Offset ------ Hex to Replace ---------- ASM Code
NTSC 1.02 ---- 0x18E348 -----
DBE10040 BF61002C 7C7B1B78 4BFFDEC1 3BC30000 387B0000 4BFFDEAD 801E0000
83BB0028 2C000009 3B7D0000 41800014 387B0000 38800010 481E05FD 48000134
387B0000 38800010 481E07ED 281D0000 4082000C 38000000 48000008 801D0010
90010014 80610014 28030000 4082000C 38600000 48000008 80630008
->
7C671B78 8063002C 8084049C 80A31068 7CA62B78 38A50020 2C050140 40A10008
38A00140 90A31068 7CC631D6 54C6A33E 7C062000 41A0000C 38800000 48000008
7C862050 7CE33B78 4BF09100 807F198C 809F1988 7C632378 2C030000 40820018
807F1068 2C030000 41A2000C 3863FFFF 907F1068 807F1990 4BED8C38


	-==-


Wall Bracing (SDR Statically placed @ 801917E4)
Its main purpose is to get rid of wall infinites.
If you are on the ground and you're moving into a wall (either by purposely walking/running into it or, more likely, if you're being shined into the wall), if you get hit by a non-launching attack, you can press the analog stick left or right to brace against the wall, which will make your feet leave the ground. The direction you press doesn't matter, and this was purposefully done to help with Smash DI (which is actually just a justification for my laziness. - _glook).
[_glook]
Version -- DOL Offset ------ Hex to Replace ---------- ASM Code
NTSC 1.02 ---- 0x18E3C4 -----
28030000 4082000C 38600000 48000008 80630008 28030000 4082000C 38000000
48000008 80030008 28000000 9001000C 4082000C 38000000
->
2C1C0003 41820030 887D0724 70630004 2C030004 40A20020 807D0620 2C030000
4082000C 38600001 48000008 38600000 2C030000 4BEFC798


	-==-


Capped (Tennis) Mode (SDR Statically placed @ 8019181C)
treats the Stock Match Time Limit as a points cap in Time mode and a coin cap in Coin Mode (coin cap is the minutes set times 100). It essentially ends the match immediately once one of the players has reached the point or coin limit/cap. Setting Stock Match Time Limit to None turns this off, so you can still play normally if you want to.
[_glook]
Version -- DOL Offset ------ Hex to Replace ---------- ASM Code
NTSC 1.02 ---- 0x18E3FC -----
4800000C 8061000C 80030008 90010010 801E0000 2C000006 41800098 3C608048 386399B8 3B83000F 8803000F 28000014

Disable Tap Jump (SDR Statically placed @ 80191930)
Affects all players
[Achilles]

Random Hitbox Elements - Every Non-projectile Attack (SDR Statically placed @ 8019195C)
All Non-projectile attacks will have a random effect, rather than their normal one.
[Achilles]

Change banner color at CSS (SDR Statically linked)
[Dan Salvato]

	-==-


Flush Cache on Scene Change
When scene changes, the Dolphin cache should flush (so any on the fly code changes apply).
SDR Note: This is a bit of a hack, as code shouldn't really be rewritten on the fly. So we shouldn't need this after we re-write all of our toggles to toggle based off variables instead.
[Dan Salvato]
Version -- DOL Offset ------ Hex to Replace ---------- ASM Code
NTSC 1.02 ---- 0x1A1750 ------ 4E800020 -> Branch
3C608000 3C80003C 3D808000 618C543C
7D8903A6 4E800420 48000000
